Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; trace of added white band at bottom of sherd; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Naukratis, Possibly Site 28 (Petrie) [based on pencil mark]
Curator's comments: The numbers 4 (scored through) and 28(d) are written in pencil on the sherd's interior surface. Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis (Williams 1983, 169). Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 74)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 721, no. 796)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1806) (phase 2)
